Scott Griggs

Atlanta, Georgia area · (678) 469-0468 · sgriggs@gmail.com

I've been lucky enough to have been able to pursue my dream of a career in aviation, but I have really missed working in IT. I am excited to rekindle my IT career and work with AWS cloud technologies. I recently passed two AWS certifications and I am excited to start using the skills I learned.

Experience

Airline Pilot

Atlantic Southeast Airlines / ExpressJet Airlines

Crew resource team member responsible for the safety of the passengers, crew, cargo, and aircraft during all phases of flight. I have flown the CRJ-200, CRJ-700, CRJ-900, and the Embraer E-175. I have flown more than 10,000 hours as an airline transport pilot.

October 2005 - Present

Flight Instructor / Ground Instructor

AirVentures Flight School

Capitalize on low hanging fruit to identify a ballpark value added activity to beta test. Override the digital divide with additional clickthroughs from DevOps. Nanotechnology immersion along the information highway will close the loop on focusing solely on the bottom line.

June 2004 - October 2005

Senior UNIX Administrator

The Weather Channel

Coordinated the conversion of our SAN from EMC Symmetrix 5 to Hitachi 9960 hardware. Migrated all systems to the new hardware and setup development, test, and production Veritas clusters attached to the Hitachi via Brocade switches. Planned and coordinated the migration of all data from EMC to Hitachi.

UNIX system administrator for the interactive television development team and content group. They provided weather graphics for interactive television customers. My duties encompassed all their UNIX administration needs. This included development software loads and updates and all other day-to-day needs of the development team. The equipment supported consisted of (2) Sun E450’s and (4) Sun E250’s.

Implemented our EMC storage solution into our data center. This required that I work closely with our EMC support engineers to integrate the equipment into our legacy system infrastructure and facilitate its use with our current and future projects. The system was a Symmetrix 5 with 1 TB of storage.

I provided day-to-day support for all Sun servers. This involved working with our solution center, development teams, and DBA group on a daily basis to provide 24/7 coverage and support.

April 2000 - November 2003

UNIX Consultant

The People Network

UNIX system administrator in the Production Services and Support group providing Tier II support for systems and applications and Tier III support for new projects. As Tier III, I was lead admin for the projects assigned to me, which required coordination between the admin group, DBA group, the network group, and the project manager to ensure the projects were successfully completed with the time frame assigned. As Tier II, I provided day-to-day UNIX support as required for applications and systems, which included working tickets from Support Magic as problems were reported to the help desk. The most common daily Tier II activities were NIS, DNS, backup, intranet issues, and user administration. My major projects were Brio, Inconcert, and notes migration to Sun.

UNIX system administrator for software development project. Provided general UNIX support in test, development, and production environments for the development team. The equipment supported was (2) Sun E4000 and (2) Sun E6000 running Solaris 2.5.1 with multiple Oracle instances on each.

Setup hardware for an Oracle PDB cluster containing (2) Sun E6000 and (4) fully populated RSM storage arrays. Install Solaris 2.5.1, all required software patches, the PDB software and configured it for use.

October 1997 - April 2000

UNIX Analyst

Paranet, Inc.

I worked multiple contracts for Sun Professional services installing Oracle Parallel Database clusters for clients which included, Oracle, CNN, and the State of Georgia.

October 1995 - October 1997

UNIX System Administrator

Delta Air Lines Inc. / TransQuest Information Solutions Inc.

UNIX administrator responsible for the corporate SMTP server. Managed the corporate firewall, NIS+, NFS, and DNS servers. Monitored and maintained 100+ Sun workstations and servers.

February 1991 - October 1995

Interests

When I'm not flying the friendly skies I like to spend my time at home tinkering with electronics and trying to keep up with my wife and our three Chessapeake Bay Retrievers. I voluteer in the machine shop with the Commemorative Air Force and occasionally keep bees.
